titles.title: Policyholder Disaster Protection Act of 2011
Policyholder Disaster Protection Act of 2011

To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide for the creation of disaster protection funds by property and casualty insurance companies for the payment of policyholders' claims arising from future catastrophic events.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade .

bill.summary: Policyholder Disaster Protection Act of 2011 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow insurance companies (other than life insurance companies) to make tax deductible contributions to a tax-exempt policyholder disaster protection fund established by this Act for the payment of policyholders' claims arising from certain catastrophic events, such as windstorms, earthquakes, fires, or floods.
